roleset.name: motion
roleset.note: COME-V NOTES: Based on big corpus, comparison with 'go'. Member of VNcls escape-51.1-2. (from come.01-v)
COMING-N NOTES: Added by Julia based on BOLT. Corresponds to VNcls escape-51.1. (from coming.01-n)

roles.note: Often takes argM-DIR, (up, down, etc.). Medium should be tagged ArgM-LOC. (from come.01-v)

example.name: come-v: destination
example.text: Mrs. Yeargin came to work on weekends.

example.name: come-v: with purpose
example.text: Students, teachers, and parents came to testify on her behalf.

example.name: come-v: destination as by-phrase
example.text: You may come by the agency to read but not copy the books.
example.arg: to read but not copy the books

example.name: come-v: come back (not phrasal)
example.text: They aren't going to come back to the US.

example.name: come-v: nice syntactic reversal
example.text: ``So crunch, crunch, crunch, bang, bang, bang -- here-4 come [*T*-4] the ringers from above, making a very obvious exit while the congregation is at prayer,'' he says.
example.arg: making a very obvious exit while the congregation is at prayer

example.name: come-v: temporal coming
example.text: It is also the sovereign power that, come 1997, will take over this British colony.

example.name: ARG1
example.text: In contrast , Taiwan is still showing a nasty deficit in knowledge trade , with money going out twice as fast as it is coming in .

example.name: come-v: another with start point
example.text: But at the time when he stood to speak , I was in the restroom and sort of coming back from the restroom
example.arg: at the time when he stood to speak

example.name: coming-n: arg1
example.text: Haha , that s what I said in conversation with someone last night , she 's the second coming of Dan Quayle !

roleset.name: pursue (often with after), pursuing
roleset.note: COME-V NOTES: No VNcls. (from come.02-v)
COMING-N NOTES: Added by Julia based on come.02. No VNcls. (from coming.02-n)

example.name: come-v: come after
example.text: Portfolio managers come after the highest rates.

example.name: coming-n: Both args
example.text: He runs the risk of their coming after him immediately

roleset.name: arise (from)
roleset.note: COME-V NOTES: Member of VNcls appear-48.1.1. (from come.03-v)

role.descr: source, basis on which arg1 comes to be (not start point of motion!)

example.name: come-v: arise in
example.text: Part of the charm comes in recognizing one's self in the novel.
example.arg: in recognizing one's self in the novel

example.name: come-v: arise of
example.text: Ringers are filled with the solemn intoxication that-1 *trace*-1 comes of intricate ritual faultlessly performed.

example.name: come-v: origin of being
example.text: Yes , I do recall Bill Buckingham making comments about , you know , the apes and monkeys - *PRO*-3 coming from apes and monkeys .

roleset.name: become, arrive at a certain state of being
roleset.note: COME-V NOTES: No VNcls. (from come.04-v)

example.name: come-v: come true
example.text: Its forecasts didn't come true.

example.name: come-v: come of age
example.text: The attack commercial has come of age in an off-election year.

example.name: come-v: come under scrutiny
example.text: But the growing controversy comes as many practices historically accepted as normal here -- such as politicians accepting substantial gifts from businessmen or having extramarital affairs -- are coming under close ethical scrutiny.
example.arg: many practices historically accepted as normal here -- such as politicians accepting substantial gifts from businessmen or having extramarital affairs --

example.name: come-v: come to a head
example.text: The ``one-yen'' controversy first came to a head last week when the city of Hiroshima announced that Fujitsu won a contract to design a computer system to map its waterworks.
example.arg: when the city of Hiroshima announced that Fujitsu won a contract to design a computer system to map its waterworks

example.name: come-v: come to a halt
example.text: Despite the economic slowdown, there are few clear signs that growth is coming to a halt.

example.name: come-v: come to an end
example.text: ``Actually, [the long deterioration in daily newspapers]-1 shows signs of [*]-1 coming to an end, and the industry looks pretty healthy.''

example.name: come-v: come as
example.text: That may not come as a surprise to Americans who have watched the Japanese snap up properties in the U.S. from golf courses to a stake in Rockefeller Center.
example.arg: as a surprise to Americans who have watched the Japanese snap up properties in the U.S. from golf courses to a stake in Rockefeller Center

roleset.name: pertaining to inclusion in a purchase
roleset.note: COME-V NOTES: No VNcls. No FN class. (from come.05-v) Attempt at clearing up disambiguity between this an come.16, by Julia, during MWE framing.

example.name: come-v
example.text: I'm sure the house came with a child sized hole kicked in already.
example.arg: with a child sized hole kicked in already

example.name: come-v
example.text: It also came with free balance and rotation for the life of the car
example.arg: with free balance and rotation for the life of the car

example.name: come-v
example.text: which all came way over budget

example.name: come-v: non-specific price
example.text: Chateau Yquem now comes dear.

roleset.name: come to: speaking of
roleset.note: COME-V NOTES: No VNcls. (from come.12-v)

example.name: Zen-like blase
example.text: But as the French embody a Zen-like state of blase when-1 it comesto athletics [*T*-1] (try finding a Nautilus machine in Paris), myfellow conventioners were having none of it.

roleset.name: ring up at a certain monetary value
roleset.note: COME-V NOTES: No VNcls. (from come.16-v)

example.name: come-v
example.text: Last year, the Cowboys' share of that pie came to $17.6 million.
example.arg: the Cowboys' share of that pie

example.name: come-v
example.text: As for the stability fund, that comes to $10 billion per year, maybe half of which is actually for high-risk patients.

roleset.name: serial verb construction
roleset.note: COME-V NOTES: Added by Julia based on BOLT. Comparison to go.05. No VNcls. (from come.28-v)

example.name: come-v: both args
example.text: I 'm studying abroad for a year and [my boyfriend]-1 is going [*-1]-2 to come *PRO*-2 visit me a few times times .
example.arg: *PRO*-2 visit me a few times times

example.name: come-v:
example.text: if you-1 want *-1 to come skiing/snowboarding this Saturday you can join the event here

roleset.name: acclimate to fate
roleset.note: COME_TO_TERMS-M NOTES: No VNcls. No FN class. (from come.14-v) Revamped as MWE by Julia during initial MWE framing.

example.name: come_to_terms-m
example.text: In the coming decade, analysts say, U.S.-Japanese relations will be tested as Tokyo comes to terms with its new status as the region's economic behemoth.
example.arg: with its new status as the region's economic behemoth

roleset.name: occur, as a result of circumstances
roleset.note: COME_ABOUT-V NOTES: See VNcls appear-48.1.1. (from come.06-v)

example.name: come_about-v: just object
example.text: Steeper prices have come about because supplies are low.

roleset.name: arrive on the scene in a particular state, enter ranking
roleset.note: COME_IN-V NOTES: No VNcls. (from come.07-v)

example.name: come_in-v: I cannot imagine why
example.text: Buick came in fourth among US cars.

example.name: come_in-v: come in handy
example.text: If E.E. ``Buzzy'' Geduld is right, a seatbelt may come in handy during the next few sessions.

roleset.name: activate
roleset.note: COME_ON-V NOTES: No VN or FN class. (from come.08-v)

example.name: come_on-v: unaccusative
example.text: The lights came on this morning.

roleset.name: discoursey, but based on motion
roleset.note: COME_ON-V NOTES: Added based on Brown corpus. No VN or FN classes. (from come.25-v)

roles.note: Make sure all tagging happens within the span! If they don't tree it with connected args or traces, leave it alone! (from come.25-v)

role.descr: entity who needs to get with the program (and maybe move)

example.name: come_on-v: Get real, dude
example.text: -NONE- * Come on , now .

roleset.name: progress, develop, come across
roleset.note: COME_ON-V NOTES: Added by Julia based on BOLT, comparison to come_off.24. No VNcls. (from come.29-v)

example.name: come_on-v: both args
example.text: Be casual , as you run the risk of *PRO* coming on too strong if you do anything seriously Valentine 's - y .
example.arg: if you do anything seriously Valentine's-y

roleset.name: appear
roleset.note: COME_OUT-V NOTES: See VNcls appear-48.1.1. (from come.09-v)

example.name: come_out-v: unaccusative
example.text: Scoring High first came out in 1979.

example.name: come_out-v: with attribute
example.text: Not that Washington and Tokyo disagree on the Japanese acquisitions; indeed, each has come out in favor of unfettered investment in the U.S.
example.arg: in favor of unfettered investment in the U.S.

example.name: come_out-v: with arg0
example.text: At the moment you 're just coming out with general words that do n't really make any sense or have any true application in real life .
example.arg: with general words that don't really make any sense or have any true application in real life

roleset.name: become publicly gay (or publicly announce some other attribute that was formerly kept secret)

mappings.target: (A / make-02 :arg0 (n / NARG0) :arg1 (p / public-02 :arg1 (n1 / NARG1 :domain n) :arg2 (n2 / NARG2)))

roleset.note: COME_OUT-V NOTES: No VNcls. (from come.10-v) Converted to MWE format by Julia during MWE framing.

example.name: come_out_of_closet-m: generic idiomatic
example.text: John came out of the closet last week.

example.name: come_out-m: with audience
example.text: John came out to his family last week.

example.name: come_out-m
example.text: After keeping her sexuality a secret for years, comedian Ellen DeGeneres publicly came out as a lesbian in 1997.
example.arg: After keeping her sexuality a secret for years

example.name: come_out-m
example.text: This was the first time [0]-1 I came out as a closet Trump supporter to my friends *-1 and they immediately threw me under the bus.

example.name: come_out_of_closet-m: arg1 attribute of closet
example.text: Only after *PRO*-1 coming out of the religious closet was I-1 able to finally explore what I liked sexually, and then I came out of the gay closet.

roleset.name: devise, bring forth
roleset.note: COME_UP-V NOTES: No VNcls. (from come.11-v)

role.descr: thing devised, brought forth, come up with

example.name: come_up-v: Transitive
example.text: Sellers-1 are in a race *trace*-1 to come up with the priciest bottle.

roleset.name: arise unexpectedly
roleset.note: COME_UP-V NOTES: See VNcls appear-48.1.1. (from come.13-v)

example.name: come_up-v: partially made-up
example.text: Something has come up that makes it impossible for us to meet today.
example.arg: [Something] [that makes it impossible for us to meet today]

example.name: come_up-v: with attribute
example.text: Although sports officials predict jumps of 50% to 100% in the major contracts coming up for renewal, ad rates may rise only 20%.

roleset.name: seem, be seen as
roleset.note: COME_ACROSS-V NOTES: See VNcls appear-48.1.1. (from come.15-v)
COME_OFF-V NOTES: Roleset for 'come off' based on instances in wsj roleset corrections. Framed by Claire. (from come.24-v)
COME_OVER-V NOTES: Added by Julia based on BOLT, comparison to come_off.24. (from come.30-v)

example.name: come_across-v: no more concatenation!
example.text: Such sudden cultural shifts may come across as a bit forced, but they seem to be genuine -- so much so, in fact, that some older employees have resisted.

example.name: come_off-v
example.text: He 's put a fresh spin on material [that]-1 *-1 could come off terribly cliched ; for example , the way Susie wows an audience the first time she sings with the Baker Boys .

example.name: come_over-m: both args
example.text: I raised all these issues and I came over totally un-British and just spoke my mind , he just said that " the car is covered by our Audi warranty " , hardly the response I was looking for if I was considering a purchase .

roleset.name: find, discover, usually unintentionally
roleset.note: COME_ACROSS-V NOTES: No VNcls. (from come.21-v)

example.name: come_across-v: Poetic Discovery
example.text: Sometimes-1, [when tidying up works of poetry from years before]-2, hewould come across one that he had no recollection of * ever writing *T*-1 *T*-2.
example.arg: one that he had no recollection of ever writing

roleset.name: fulfill, live up to
roleset.note: COME_THROUGH-V NOTES: No VN or FN classes. (from come.17-v)

example.name: come_through-v: when push comes to shove
example.text: Various ministries decided the products businessmen could produce and how much; and government-owned banks controlled the financing of projects and monitored whether companies came through on promised plans.

roleset.name: become apparent
roleset.note: COME_THROUGH-V NOTES: No VNcls. (from come.18-v)

example.name: come_through-v: bork bork bork
example.text: Perhaps because they won, Mr. Bork's attackers come through more vividly than his defenders.

roleset.name: progress
roleset.note: COME_ALONG-V NOTES: No VNcls. (from come.19-v)

example.name: come_along-v: just swimmingly
example.text: As to negotiations with creditors, Mr. Lorenzo said in remarks after the conference ``we'll have to see how they [talks] come along.''

roleset.name: come by: acquire
roleset.note: COME_BY-V NOTES: No VNcls. (from come.20-v)

example.name: come_by-v: with agent
example.text: They came by their strangeness honestly.

roleset.name: come down with an illness
roleset.note: COME_DOWN-V NOTES: No VNcls. (from come.22-v)

example.name: come_down-v: fever, probably typical usage
example.text: When the weather turned cool and Chien-chien came down with a fever,Martine called my wife * to offer * to keep Chien-chien for the night.

roleset.name: it comes down to x (results in/responsibility of)
roleset.note: COME_DOWN-V NOTES: Roleset based on instances in webtext 2.5 (1000-1099). No verbnet entry, no framenet entry. No comparison. Framed by Katie. (from come.23-v)

example.name: come_down-v: Example with both arguments
example.text: Then it came down to who t *1 had the bad luck of PRO *2 sitting on the side of the car that was angled out.
example.arg: to who had the bad luck of PRO *2 sitting on the side the car that was angled out.

example.name: come_down-v: 'it'; with more substance
example.text: The game came down to a coin-toss.

roleset.name: find, discover, stumble upon
roleset.note: COME_UPON-V NOTES: Added by Julia based on BOLT. Comparison to 'come_across.21'. No VNcls. (from come.26-v)

example.name: come_upon-v: Both args
example.text: For any who were n't already aware Huntster believes he came upon a sasquatch trackway ...

roleset.name: regain consciousness
roleset.note: COME_TO-V NOTES: Based on temprel data. No comparison. No VN class. Framed by Katie. (from come.27-v)

example.name: coming_to-v: re-enter the world around you
example.text: He lost consciousness for approximately two seconds and then came to.

roleset.name: volunteer
roleset.note: COME_FORWARD-V NOTES: Added by Julia during initial MWE framing.

example.name: come_forward-v
example.text: Many celebrities came forward to adopt villages.

roleset.name: change one's mind
roleset.note: COME_AROUND-V NOTES: Added by Julia during MWE framing.

example.name: come-v: come_around
example.text: They do at least come around to [*] saying that the courts might want to end ``rigid affirmative action programs.''
example.arg: to [*] saying that the courts might want to end ``rigid affirmative action programs
